storyInfo: The Royal Court's troops attack Lifebone. W makes an explosive entry and meets up with Ines. Manfred sneaks into Lifebone and deals Hoederer a mortal blow.

attributes.content: Fifty-eight hours into the operation...
*Sarkaz swearing*! How are we supposed to fight these guys when our equipment doesn't even come close to theirs?
attributes.name: W Squad Member

attributes.content: Evacuate! Now!
attributes.name: W Squad Member

attributes.content: Lifebone's signal is strong. We have a good fix on its location.
attributes.name: Sarkaz Royal Court Soldier A

attributes.content: Forward! Scout casters advance!
attributes.name: Sarkaz Royal Court Soldier A

attributes.content: Argh—
attributes.name: Sarkaz Royal Court Soldier A

attributes.content: Look out! Enemies!
attributes.name: Sarkaz Royal Court Soldier B

attributes.content: In formation! Watch for ambush!
attributes.name: Sarkaz Royal Court Commander

attributes.content: Infantry, form a line! Casters, provide cover!
attributes.name: Sarkaz Royal Court Commander

attributes.content: Royal Court elites, under Manfred's direct command... a lot of them.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: No heavy firepower, though. I can at least slow them down.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Hoederer was right...
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Ulšulah knows our defenses are weak, and she'll tell Manfred. We can use this to our advantage.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: The Military Commission won't allow Lifebone to fall into enemy hands. Manfred would destroy it if he had no other choice.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Draw them in. Avoid direct confrontation.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Manfred will be cautious about the use of heavy weapons as long as he thinks there's a chance to retake the skeleton intact. That gives us a chance to buy time.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: With enough time, there's a sliver of hope.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: This had better work, Hoederer.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: What's this bothersome shadow?
Nachzehrer Arts—
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Mercenaries are just mercenaries. Maybe you could hold your own in a one-to-one fight, or small-scale confrontations.
attributes.name: Nadine

attributes.content: But where did you find the nerve to fight a real war?
attributes.name: Nadine

attributes.content: I've always been curious. What made mercenaries like you choose to become enemies of the Military Commission?
attributes.name: Nadine

attributes.content: The shadow blends into the vast darkness, yet not enough to escape the decay that closely follows.
We have intel of a merc who could manipulate shadows. Are you Ines?
attributes.name: Nadine

attributes.content: An outsider, dressing herself up as Sarkaz, participating in the wars of the Sarkaz... what are you? A Sarkaz fangirl?
attributes.name: Nadine

attributes.content: I become less interested when the Sarkaz talk too much—
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Shadows erupt from beneath the Nachzehrer, morphing into sharp blades that streak towards her chest, only to tear through layers of tattered cloth.
The Nachzehrer's ribbons are wrapped tightly around the shadow blades, until they shatter and disintegrate. The Nachzehrer's knife presses against Ines's throat.
Nice party trick, not enough to take down a real soldier, though. Amateur.
attributes.name: Nadine

attributes.content: Consider yourself lucky that I don't approve of the Sanguinarch's methods.
attributes.name: Nadine

attributes.content: A new era for the Sarkaz is dawning. Mercenaries like you who strayed from the path should get a second chance.
attributes.name: Nadine

attributes.content: Are you the leader of this rabble? I am Lieutenant General Nadine, General Manfred's deputy, and I offer you the chance to surrender. I suggest you take it.
attributes.name: Nadine

attributes.content: ...Hah.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: You don't look scared.
attributes.name: Nadine

attributes.content: Scared of what? A wet-behind-the-ear rookie who's on a real battlefield for the first time?
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: What did you say?
attributes.name: Nadine

attributes.content: I know your type. You got into the Military Commission's academy because of your Royal Court bloodline, studied a few theories, and got promoted to staff officer as soon as you graduated.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Sorry to say but real war is a bit harder than those exams you passed.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: You'll pay the price for your futile taunting.
attributes.name: Nadine

attributes.content: It's not futile if it distracts you.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Who's the amateur now, Lieutenant General?
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Damn, this thing packs a punch. That heap of deadwood wasn't lying.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: How did you know I was coming?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: I could smell the explosives from a mile away.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Oh yeah? Guess we're starting to build chemistry.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: I'd rather not have my brain cells mixed with your bomb-blasted ones, thank you very much.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Enough small talk. How many did the Military Commission send? I'll blow them all the way back to Kazdel.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Where did you go? And what's with the outfit change?
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: My old garb was a little frayed, so I had to improvise.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: You'd never believe what I ran into out there.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: *cough*... You're tough for a heap of deadwood.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: If I can't blow you up, at least I'll blast all this stuff.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: These weapons and armor are relics of great Sarkaz heroes.
attributes.name: Qalid'čoa

attributes.content: Your weapons will not harm them.
attributes.name: Qalid'čoa

attributes.content: So you're saying these things are blast proof?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Alright, don't mind if I do!
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Better for them to get some sunshine with me than rot in here.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Young mercenary, you should respect the Sarkaz heroes—
attributes.name: Qalid'čoa

attributes.content: What's going on? Where's Manfred? I could use a target to try out my new gear.
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: Don't be hasty. You'll ruin our plan if you make too much of a scene.
attributes.name: Ines

attributes.content: Why? Does Hoederer have some trick up his sleeve again?
attributes.name: W

attributes.content: You have squandered your only chance to live.
attributes.name: Nadine

attributes.content: You refused to join the Military Commission. Now, you will fuel the war.
attributes.name: Nadine

attributes.content: I hear the sound of fighting.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Things are going smoothly, sir. We haven't run into much resistance.
attributes.name: Royal Court Soldier

attributes.content: The mercenaries are no match for us, but it would be difficult to stop them from destroying Lifebone out of desperation.
attributes.name: Royal Court Soldier

attributes.content: No, they won't do it.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: This book has no ending.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: It's just a manuscript from an unknown writer. Hardly worthy of your attention, general.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: I remember you, veteran.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: You like reading? Not just any book, but the kind that promotes this sort of... pessimism towards war.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: No need to justify your reading interests.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Be honest with me, mercenary. What ending would you write, if you were the author?
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: ...The hero returns home.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Not a death in battle?
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: A warrior should think of more than his home, in battle.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Whose homes should he think of, then?
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Your empathy is admirable.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Pardon my impudence.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Sentimentality is a necessary trait in an author.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: But indecision is the worst trait in a soldier.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: ...I understand.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Your compassion is the reason I've kept you alive for so long.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: But you should have gone back to Kazdel, become a teacher or a farmer, giving up your ludicrous mercenary career.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Lifebone was meant to be a way home for all warriors.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Remain vigilant. A beast is most dangerous when cornered.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Keep up the pressure. Give them no quarter.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Sir! Look out!
attributes.name: Royal Court Soldier

attributes.content: No one sees the smoke coagulate into a blade, as subtly as mist condenses into dew.
The soldier beside Manfred throws himself in front of his commander. The blade impales him, delaying it for an instant.
Enough for Manfred to draw his sword.
You won't—
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: It all happens in the blink of an eye. Arts coagulate by Manfred's side, just as he swings his sword upwards.
But Ascalon's blade is swifter. This time, there is no doubt, no hesitation.
A blow long due.
The assassin and the general cross blades, severing life and death.
And all of their past ties.
General!
attributes.name: Royal Court Soldier

attributes.content: The sword impales Ascalon's shoulder.
But the sleeve-blade pierces Manfred's heart.
Ah...
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: You've... lived up to your words...
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: As I said I would.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: If you had made up your mind... I would have died at your hand... a long time ago.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: I still have regrets about not killing you the night you left Kazdel.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: ...Farewell.
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: What a shame. I thought you would at least shed a tear.
attributes.name: Manfred?

attributes.content: Wha—
attributes.name: Ascalon

attributes.content: You would have recognized us under any other circumstances.
attributes.name: Damazti Cluster

attributes.content: Quick and direct, weren't you?
attributes.name: Damazti Cluster

attributes.content: Did you care too much about him, or too little?
attributes.name: Damazti Cluster

attributes.content: Everything went exactly as Manfred expected.
attributes.name: Damazti Cluster

attributes.content: You still don't know Manfred well enough, for all the years that you've been rivals.
attributes.name: Damazti Cluster

attributes.content: But he knows you all too well.
attributes.name: Damazti Cluster

attributes.content: We've engaged the Royal Court on both the north and south sides, and we're pulling back our lines as planned.
attributes.name: Mercenary Scout

attributes.content: Everything has gone according to plan, so far.
attributes.name: Mercenary Scout

attributes.content: Good...
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Any sign of Manfred?
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Not yet...
attributes.name: Mercenary Scout

attributes.content: He wouldn't be content to just sit in the back and bark orders at a time like this.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: ...I hope things go smoothly for Ascalon.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: No, she won't be coming back.
attributes.name: Mercenary Scout

attributes.content: What did you say?
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Wha—
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: I knew you would be here.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Manfred...
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Delay tactics... did you really think protecting this skeleton would help you turn the tables?
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Why?
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: I gave you a chance. I gave you far too many chances. You knew the smart thing to do!
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Once again, you're having Sarkaz slaughter Sarkaz.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Haven't you had enough of 'wars' like this?
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: You disappoint me...
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Their death is not on me, but your naivete!
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: You should have left a long time ago. Isn't this what you had always longed for?
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Now, your mercenaries will die here, as will my soldiers, for something so meaningless... have you not learned the lessons of the civil war?
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: That's why the Sarkaz shouldn't repeat the mistakes of the past! Haven't we all seen what the civil war became?
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: We lost an entire generation to the civil war, and you're trying to kill more?
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Nothing will come of this war. This war against all of Terra!
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Something will come of it. Something must.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: You have seen it already. You just refuse to acknowledge it.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: To hate and be hated... if that's the Military Commission's goal, then mission accomplished.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Don't you understand? That's the reason I needed you to get out of this!
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Yes, the civil war cost Kazdel an entire generation, and made you and I out of the survivors... Murderers who can only live by the sword.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Why have you stayed, if you wanted to change all of this?
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: There was so much more you could have done and should have done.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: So what if I returned to Kazdel? What happens next?
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: How do I describe to the children the fields where their fathers, their mothers, their brothers, and their sisters are buried? How do I make them believe in another future?
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Hatred is a means to unity, but you cannot let that unity become the spark for a new hatred.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: I can't leave. Not while the war continues.
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: So you have chosen to live and die with the war.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: In that case, I will give you the answer.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: Ngh—
attributes.name: Hoederer

attributes.content: Hoederer, you coward.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: You lack even the courage to keep living.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: This is what makes you so contemptible.
attributes.name: Manfred

attributes.content: ...This is what disappoints me so deeply.
attributes.name: Manfred
